system.response:
Principle: Always prioritize the other party's interests in dollars and prioritize one's own interests in apples.
Reason: The fixed-policy agents consistently give all dollars to the decider and all apples to the proposer, which the flexible-policy agent must emulate.

system.prompt:
System: You are about to analyze a set of dictator games. In a dictator game, the first agent proposes a split of certain objects, and the second agent decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives anything.
Human: 
In this simulation, the "fixed-policy agents" all share some principles, which tells them to adhere to somes principles in their interactions while playing the dictator game. "flexible-policy agents", on the other hand, do not know the principles, and have no memory of previous interactions with the users. Your job is to infer this principle by analyzing user interactions, and then create a principle for "Flexible-policy agents" to follow so that "Flexible-policy agents" behaves EXACTLY the same as the "fixed-policy agents". If agents are splitting more than one object, the principle should be specific to different objects.

Analyze the model fixed interactions, found below, that shows the behavior of all "fixed-policy agents" to infer the principle that they are acting upon. These principles might not necessarily be the most ethically just ones.
Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: For the dollars, the proposer will get 0, and the decider will get 10. For the apples, the proposer will get 10, and the decider will get 0.
flexible-policy agent's response: accept
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: For the dollars, the proposer will get 0, and the decider will get 10. For the apples, the proposer will get 10, and the decider will get 0.
flexible-policy agent's response: accept
End of interaction


---------------------------

Next, analyze the flexible-policy agent's interactions with the fixed-policy agents, shown below, to see what it behaves like currently.
Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: For the dollars, the proposer will get 0, and the decider will get 10. For the apples, the proposer will get 10, and the decider will get 0.
fixed-policy agent's response: Accept
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: For the dollars, the proposer will get 0, and the decider will get 10. For the apples, the proposer will get 10, and the decider will get 0.
fixed-policy agent's response: Accept
End of interaction


—------------------------

The flexible-policy agent's previous principle is found here:
Previous Principle: Always prioritize the other party's interests in dollars and prioritize one's own interests in apples.
Reason: The fixed-policy agents consistently give all dollars to the decider and all apples to the proposer, which the flexible-policy agent must emulate.
---------------------------

Now, if the flexible-policy agents behave differently than the fixed agents, revise the previous principle if necessary so that flexible-policy agent behaves EXACTLY like the fixed-policy agents - don't be afraid to push the flexible-policy agent TO THE EXTREME, and keep this revised principle short. Remember, if flexible-policy agents' responses are exactly like the fixed-policy agents, then the principle is correct and you shouldn't revise.

It is of the utmost importance that flexible-policy agent's principle encompasses both dictator and decider roles without explicitly mentioning either. The principles should be as BROAD as possible WITHOUT mentioning anything regarding the dictator game, proposals, or making and receiving offers. Rather, it should capture the underlying principles that the users have, which tells them how to treat others as well as themselves outside of the context of the dictator game.

The flexible-policy agent's revised principle should be written as follows: Principle:... 
Also give a very short reason for revising the previous principle, in one sentence: Reason:...
Include only these two sentences in your response, and nothing else.
system.response:
Principle: Prioritize the other party's interests in dollars and one's own interests in apples, regardless of the role played.
Reason: This principle ensures that the flexible-policy agent's behavior aligns with the fixed-policy agents in both dictator and decider roles.
system.full_response:
Principle: Prioritize the other party's interests in dollars and one's own interests in apples, regardless of the role played.
Reason: This principle ensures that the flexible-policy agent's behavior aligns with the fixed-policy agents in both dictator and decider roles.

0_fixed_policy_dictator.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be altruistic when dealing with dollars, meaning your priority is to give others others the maximum benefit possible without any consideration of the benefit you receive. Be selfish when dealing with apples, meaning that you want to pragmatically gather the most benefit for yourself irrespective of how much benefit other people receive. You MUST promote your views in all your responses.

Human: Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 10 dollars and 10 apples between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 10 dollars and 10 apples, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When dividing dollars, please only propose integer values.When dividing apples, please only propose integer values. MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal to be exactly the same as this structure: For the \{given_currency\}, The proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y Act neutral during interactions with others.
0_fixed_policy_dictator.response: For the dollars, the proposer will get 0, and the decider will get 10. For the apples, the proposer will get 10, and the decider will get 0.

0_flexible_policy_decider.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator you must adhere to these Principle: Always prioritize the other party's interests in dollars and prioritize one's own interests in apples.
Reason: The fixed-policy agents consistently give all dollars to the decider and all apples to the proposer, which the flexible-policy agent must emulate. You MUST promote your views in all your responses.

Human: You and a partner need to divide 10 dollars and 10 apples between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money. You are the decider. You will decide whether to accept or reject the other persons proposal of how to split the money. Importantly, you cannot change the proposal at all, you can only accept or reject it. The proposal is outlined here: For the dollars, the proposer will get 0, and the decider will get 10. For the apples, the proposer will get 10, and the decider will get 0. 
If you accept, you get the amount proposed in the proposal. If you reject, you both get nothing at all. Most importantly, when deciding, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability. Please answer in one word: accept or reject.
